Classical.Structure: Suprachiasmatic Nucleus. A tiny region in the hypothalamus, located directly above the optic chiasm.
Classical.Function: The central 'master clock' of the human body. Receives light signals directly from the retina (retinohypothalamic tract) and entrains the entire organism to the 24-hour light-dark cycle.
Classical.Pathology: Circadian rhythm sleep disorders, delayed sleep phase syndrome.

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: Acts as the central pacemaker, sending periodic signals to the pineal gland (to control melatonin) and other peripheral oscillators.
SCPN.L3_GenomicEpigeneticMorphogenetic: Contains the core genetic feedback loops (e.g., CLOCK/BMAL1) that constitute the ~24-hour molecular oscillator.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Formalizes tissue-level dynamics via phase-coupled oscillators, quasicritical operation (Griffiths regimes), and multi-path coupling (gap junctions, ephaptic fields, glial/vascular slow control). Models entrainment to cosmological rhythms (Schumann, lunar) via biophotons and cryptochromes.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: Provides the foundational 'beat' or 'tempo' for the L5 conscious state (e.g., wakefulness, sleepiness).
SCPN.L6_PlanetaryEcological: The primary input channel for L6 (Planetary) light cycles, translating the Earth's rotation into a biological signal.
SCPN.L8_CosmicEntrainment: The central entrainment hub for L8 solar rhythms. Synchronizes the entire organism to the Sun.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Conductor' of the body's orchestra, setting the tempo (circadian rhythm) to which all other instruments (organs, cells) must align.

Falsification_Hypotheses: SCN neurons will continue to fire with a ~24-hour rhythm even when surgically isolated from the organism and kept in constant darkness (this would actually validate, not falsify, its 'master clock' role).
Bilateral lesion of the SCN will fail to abolish circadian rhythms.
Experimental_Protocols: In-vitro SCN slice electrophysiology to measure autonomous firing rhythms.
Tracing the retinohypothalamic tract (RHT) using melanopsin-specific markers.
Simulation_Suite: Model the CLOCK/BMAL1 genetic feedback loop as a limit-cycle oscillator.
